WorkItem.Description: I am not able to set the height of a row in less then to min height, it always taking that min height.
WorkItem.Summary: AddRow method is not taking height less then to min height

Comments.Message: I'm having the same problem. I did some poking around and w:trHeight is getting set, but it apparently doesn't make any difference if the value is less than some minimum. I don't see where that is set in the xml file.

PHPWord always sets row heights without specifying their type. Default value is "atLeast", which means, that rows with lower-than-minimum heights will have minimum height regardless of specified value.

You can solve this by adding an attribute "w:hRule" with value "exact" to the "w:tcW" element.

You can just add:
$objWriter->writeAttribute('w:hRule', 'exact');
to the class PHPWord_Writer_Word2007_Base after line 401 (which should contain: "$objWriter->writeAttribute('w:val', $height)".

This will set fixed row heights for all rows that have height specified.

This solution does not seem to be accurate (as "w:tcW" is the wrong element for this property of the document.  Please see:

[https://phpword.codeplex.com/workitem/48](https://phpword.codeplex.com/workitem/48)

for a proper solution including another valuable addition.
